poem:
"Five Fleeting Summers of Olive"

Olive at five, in the whorls of her fur lies time,
each strand a tale of joyous romp and rhyme.
Collie-cross-cattle, endurance in her genes,
holding a world that in human years transcends.
Yet sorrow tints the edges of her play,
for time's swift hand holds all hearts in its sway.
Love bittersweet, an ageless dog-day ballet.

Five! I’m doing the sums. Given the longevity of her breed – collie crossed with Australian cattle dog – she might". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
